result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

4:06 PM Defendant Michael E Hegeman in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Michael E Hegeman.  Attorney John M Wagner in court for State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.   Court apologizes to the parties for the delay, there was a very lengthy motion before this hearing.  Defense files a denovo motion.  Court has rec'd the transcript from the preliminary hearing.  Arguments heard. Court gives ruling.  BTC: Motion denied, PC should be found.  Defense asks for an arraignment date.
Arraignment scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael E Hegeman
Current: 6206 Hwy V, Caledonia, WI 53108 United States  (Effective: 09-22-2022)
Prior: 1075 Highway Z, Arkdale, WI 54613 United States

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am - 4:30 pm)  **NOTE: A $210 advance fee for installment of the SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.**

**AMENDED ON 9-22-22:  SCRAM UNIT MUST BE USED.**

1:57 PM Defendant Michael E Hegeman in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Michael E Hegeman.  Attorney John M Wagner in court for State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense has ordered the transcript.  The court reporter was on vacation and believes it can be done by Mon. Sept. 26. BTC: Matter set over.  State requests the defendant be put back on the SCRAM unit based on the violation report.  Defendant does not object.  BTC: Bond modified to add Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am - 4:30 pm)  **NOTE: A $210 advance fee for installment of the SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.**
